coins.title: Under the falls
coins.desc:
Look underwater to the left of where the water fall lands. Follow the trail of gold coins to find a blue coin at the end. There is a bubba swimming around down here who should be avoided.

You may want to avoid collecting all the gold coins on the swim down as you may need them for air on the swim back up.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: On the water (A)
coins.desc:
Two coins float just above the water. This one is to the left as you start.

Both coins are much easier to get once the water has been cleaned up starting episode 5, until then use the boat to reach them.
In episode 1 the boat is right next to the first coin instead of at the boathouse where it normally is.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: On the water (B)
coins.desc:
Two coins float just above the water. For this one, go to the left end of the cliff where it bows out in a semicircle. Then go straight out to sea from there to see the coin.

Both coins are much easier to get once the water has been cleaned up starting episode 5, until then use the boat to reach them.
In episode 1 the boat is right next to the first coin instead of at the boathouse where it normally is.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Upper right cubbyhole
coins.desc:
Go up the right cliff face and when you reach the second to last ledge, the one where the second pulley drops you off, check on the right for some narrow ledges sticking out of the cliff face.

Hover to the first one, then hover to the one on its right, where there may be a springboard. Use the springboard to get the ledge above, the do a series of back-flip and hover combinations to reach a ledge with a rocket nozzle crate. Back-flip and hover to the cubbyhole above to find a coin.

In episodes 5 and 7 the springboard is missing but it's still possible, though more difficult, to reach the ledges above it. Instead of stopping at the next to last ledge on the route to the top of the waterfall, go up another ledge, then do a triple jump right and hover.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Upper right coin stack
coins.desc:
From the ledge with the upper right cubbyhole coin, get the rocket nozzle and launch to collect gold coins and a blue coin at the top. You may have to hop just before the rocket goes off to get the extra few feet of altitude needed.

Visible in all episodes except 3, but not reachable in episode 5, 7 or 8 because the rocket nozzle isn't there.

coins.title: Under the diving board
coins.desc:
Locate the diving board shaped ledge next to the top of the water fall.

Go right and drop down to a ledge with a puddle of water, hop left from there and hover to a hole under the diving board, then collect the coin there.

In episode 6 there is a turbo nozzle crate here as well, but in other episodes there is a block of ice with a 1-up inside.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Hidden wall kicks
coins.desc:
From the hole under the diving board, drop and hover to another hole directly below. There is a vertical passage hidden behind a wall above this, though there are some windows to mark its position.

Do a series of wall jumps to get to the top and collect the coin that's visible through the windows.

See the coin "Lower pulley crevice" for an alternate and perhaps easier route.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Upper center cubbyhole
coins.desc:
Get to the top of the purple shell tower. This is easiest to do in episode 6 since there are wires you can use to get from tower to tower.

When you get to the shell entrance do a back-flip to the top. In earlier episodes you can use the rocket to this spot. From the shell, look straight toward the cliff face and notice a cubbyhole.

Rocket or hover toward it to either land inside or grab the ledge, then pick up the coin. For an alternative strategy, see the "Tricky ruins cubbyhole" coin.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Eely's domain columns (A)
coins.desc:
There are four blue coins in Eely-mouth's domain. When you enter the area, swim toward the outer walls and check the tops of the columns.

It's much easier to do this in episode 8 because the columns have gold coins as well and you can refresh your air. Also the gold coins surrounding the blue coins make it easier to spot the location from a distance.

In episode 8 there are two additional columns with gold coins only, so keep looking until you've found all six coin columns. Some of the coin columns go almost up to the ceiling so don't let yourself sink far when you're searching.

Available episodes 4 and 8 only.

coins.title: Eely's domain columns (B)
coins.desc:
There are four blue coins in Eely-mouth's domain. When you enter the area, swim toward the outer walls and check the tops of the columns.

It's much easier to do this in episode 8 because the columns have gold coins as well and you can refresh your air. Also the gold coins surrounding the blue coins make it easier to spot the location from a distance.

In episode 8 there are two additional columns with gold coins only, so keep looking until you've found all six coin columns. Some of the coin columns go almost up to the ceiling so don't let yourself sink far when you're searching.

Available episodes 4 and 8 only.

coins.title: Eely's domain columns (C)
coins.desc:
There are four blue coins in Eely-mouth's domain. When you enter the area, swim toward the outer walls and check the tops of the columns.

It's much easier to do this in episode 8 because the columns have gold coins as well and you can refresh your air. Also the gold coins surrounding the blue coins make it easier to spot the location from a distance.

In episode 8 there are two additional columns with gold coins only, so keep looking until you've found all six coin columns. Some of the coin columns go almost up to the ceiling so don't let yourself sink far when you're searching.

Available episodes 4 and 8 only.

coins.title: Eely's domain columns (D)
coins.desc:
There are four blue coins in Eely-mouth's domain. When you enter the area, swim toward the outer walls and check the tops of the columns.

It's much easier to do this in episode 8 because the columns have gold coins as well and you can refresh your air. Also the gold coins surrounding the blue coins make it easier to spot the location from a distance.

In episode 8 there are two additional columns with gold coins only, so keep looking until you've found all six coin columns. Some of the coin columns go almost up to the ceiling so don't let yourself sink far when you're searching.

Available episodes 4 and 8 only.

coins.title: Tricky ruins start
coins.desc:
Spray the stone square to open the first maze in the tricky ruins. Go to the upper left and drop down into the opening below.

Hop up to the ledge and collect the coin there.

Available all episodes except 1 and 3.

coins.title: Tricky ruins cubbyhole
coins.desc:
Get to the second maze in the tricky ruins, From the top passage, hop out and hover up to the cubbyholes above. hover from hole to hole to reach the second one from the left and get a blue coin.

Starting from the top passage is an alternate route to the 'Upper center cubbyhole' coin. Run and hop out of the cliff without hitting your head, then hover left and you should be able to reach the cubbyhole. This is tricky, but it may be faster.

Available all episodes except 1 and 3.

coins.title: Hidden ruins lower left
coins.desc:
Get the ledge between the first and second mazes of the tricky ruins. Now go to the left end of the ledge and drop to the ledge below, it has a doorway behind it.

This route doesn't work in episode 1 but you can still get to this ledge by bouncing on the floating wicker platform just off-shore.

Enter the doorway and follow the hidden passage to a shallow opening further left. Spray the wall here to open a gap between two walls. There are three doorways in the left wall and two in the right wall.

Wall jump to the lower doorway on the left, then follow the hidden passage to an opening in the cliff face where it bows out in a semicircle. Spray the squares there to reveal a blue coin in the cubbyhole behind the upper one.

coins.title: Hidden ruins middle left
coins.desc:
Open the gap between walls in the hidden ruins and wall jump to the middle doorway on the left, then follow the passage to an opening on the cliff face to the right of where the lower left tunnel opens.

Spray the wall on the left and get the blue coin from the upper cubbyhole.

coins.title: Hidden ruins upper left (A)
coins.desc:
Open the gap between walls in the hidden ruins and wall jump to the upper doorway on the left, then follow the hidden passage to an opening next to where the middle left tunnel opens. Drop from here to a very small ledge below.

Spray the wall next to this ledge to open two cubbyholes with a blue coin in the upper one. Now hop to the ledge just to the right of this and spray the squares to get a blue coin in the cubbyhole on the right.

coins.title: Hidden ruins upper left (B)
coins.desc:
Open the gap between walls in the hidden ruins and wall jump to the upper doorway on the left, then follow the hidden passage to an opening next to where the middle left tunnel opens. Drop from here to a very small ledge below.

Spray the wall next to this ledge to open two cubbyholes with a blue coin in the upper one. Now hop to the ledge just to the right of this and spray the squares to get a blue coin in the cubbyhole on the right.

coins.title: Hidden ruins lower right
coins.desc:
Open the gap between walls in the hidden ruins and wall jump to the lower doorway on the right. Follow the short hidden path to an opening to the left of ledge between the two mazes of the tricky ruins.

Collect the coin at the exit. you can also hover to the coin from the ledge nearby.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Hidden ruins upper right
coins.desc:
Open the gap between walls in the hidden ruins and wall jump to the upper doorway on the right.

Follow the hidden path to an opening high above the ledge between the two mazes of the tricky ruins.

Collect the coin at the exit. Note, this gives a way to reach the ledge between the mazes in episode 1.
You can also reach the coin from the ledge below using the rocket or by hovering across from another ruin.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Left ruins cubbyhole
coins.desc:
Go left from the start of the tricky ruins to a gap between two walls at the base of the cliff. This is directly below the hidden ruins.

Wall jump to the top and enter the doorway on the left. Follow the hidden passage to a shallow opening in the cliff below where the lower left hidden ruins passage ends. (You can spray to open a cubbyhole here but it's empty.)

Hop up to the hole and go in, you are bounced upward to the ledge above. take a moment to enjoy the view, then drop off the front of the ledge to land on a ledge above the openings from the hidden tunnels.

spray the wall here to open two cubbyholes and get a coin from the one on the left.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Hidden ruins top cubbyhole (A)
coins.desc:
You need to get to the top of the hidden ruins.

Follow the 'Left ruins cubbyhole' directions to the high ledge, the hop right and hover to the top opening where the coin is.

Alternatively, open the gap between walls in the hidden ruins and wall jump all the way to the top. Come out to a ledge and do a series of back-flips to get to the top.
Now spray the seven squares to open cubbyholes and get a coin each from the upper right and lower left (this one). What looks like a cubbyhole in the center here is actually a hole that ends on a ledge below.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Hidden ruins top cubbyhole (B)
coins.desc:
You need to get to the top of the hidden ruins.

Follow the 'Left ruins cubbyhole' directions to the high ledge, the hop right and hover to the top opening where the coin is.

Alternatively, open the gap between walls in the hidden ruins and wall jump all the way to the top. Come out to a ledge and do a series of back-flips to get to the top.
Now spray the seven squares to open cubbyholes and get a coin each from the upper right (this one) and lower left. What looks like a cubbyhole in the center here is actually a hole that ends on a ledge below.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Lower pulley crevice
coins.desc:
Go up the right cliff face as you would in episode 1. When you reach the second basket, drop from the cliff and sidle along the crevice to the left.

At the end of the crevice, spray the wall and part of it will retreat into the cliff leaving an opening you can hop into. Wall jump to collect the coin there.

(There is an alternate route to the "Hidden wall kicks" coin here. Keep following the crevice left, down at an angle for a part, to land at the hole below the other coin.)

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Upper pulley crevice
coins.desc:
Go up the right cliff face as you would in episode 1. When you reach the top of the ramp that leads to the upper pulley wheel, drop off to a small ledge behind the wheel.

Follow this ledge do an opening in the cliff, then sidle along the crevice to the left. At the end of the crevice, spray the wall and part of it will retreat into the cliff leaving an opening you can hop into.

Hop up and drop to the lower part to get the coin.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Tricky ruins M
coins.desc: Go to the ledge between the first and second mazes in the tricky ruins. Locate the graffiti M on the right and wash it off for a blue coin.

coins.title: Paired circles (A)
coins.desc:
First, follow the directions for the "Under the diving board" coin and get the turbo nozzle.

Locate the graffiti circle at the base of the right cliffs, then locate the corresponding circle behind and to the left of the boathouse.

Wash one circle off to make a blue coin appear at the other circle, then quickly get to the other circle to collect the coin before it disappears.
Turbo seems to be required to get the necessary speed.

Available episode 6 only.

coins.title: Paired circles (B)
coins.desc:
First, follow the directions for the 'Under the diving board' coin and get the turbo nozzle.

Locate the graffiti circle behind and to the left of the boathouse, then locate the corresponding circle at the base of the right cliffs.

Wash one circle off to make a blue coin appear at the other circle, then quickly get to the other circle to collect the coin before it disappears.
Turbo seems to be required to get the necessary speed.

Available episode 6 only.

coins.title: Jars in the tomb (A)
coins.desc:
Enter the kings tomb (see the StrategyWiki's episode 2 walk-through).

Locate the two large jars stored in the walls and spray them with water to get a blue coin for each. Some of the smaller vases give you gold coins as well.

You can exit through the window here to get back to the main area.

Available all episodes except 1 and 3.

coins.title: Jars in the tomb (B)
coins.desc:
Enter the kings tomb (see the StrategyWiki's episode 2 walk-through).

Locate the two large jars stored in the walls and spray them with water to get a blue coin for each. Some of the smaller vases give you gold coins as well.

You can exit through the window here to get back to the main area.

Available all episodes except 1 and 3.

coins.title: After the 1-Up
coins.desc: After the 1-Up mushroom placed on the broken sidewalk, there should be another broken sidewalk platform with the blue coin in plain sight.

coins.title: After Using The Boat (A)
coins.desc:
Using the boat, get to the platform at the end of the volcano area.

Get all the outer coins first. If you crash at this point, that's OK.

Now, get all the coins in the inner area. Hover but don't jump to the blue coins and then hover back.

coins.desc:

coins.desc:

Get all the outer coins first. If you crash at this point, that's OK.

Now, get all the coins in the inner area. Hover but don't jump to the blue coins and then hover back.

coins.title: Jail Cell
coins.desc:
Find the building with the bell tower in the southeast corner of the plaza. It is located at the opposite end of the beach from the lighthouse.

In the back on the south side, over the water, is an open window. Hop from the ledge nearby and hover into the window to land in a room with barred windows.

Liberate the coin that's doing time in there.

coins.title: Banana lady
coins.desc:
Look for a Pianta lady standing near a wall just south of the central dock.

When you talk to her she offers you work collecting fruit for her. Gather three bunches of bananas and place them in her basket, then talk to her again to be rewarded with a blue coin.

Bananas can be found in one of the fruit stalls, on a rooftop in the southeast corner of the square, and on the top of a tree west of the Pianta statue. Can be repeated for a 1-up.

coins.title: Coconut lady
coins.desc:
head to the boathouse in Delfino Plaza (where the portal to Ricco Harbor is) and look out to sea and you'll notice a small island with a palm tree and a Pianta lady.

Swim out there and talk to the lady. She'll ask you for 3 coconuts, and as luck would have it, there are 3 coconuts hanging in the tree right next to her. Spray them to knock them down and then put the in her basket one by one.

Don't worry if some of them fall in the sea as they will grow back again straight away. Can be repeated for a 1-up.

coins.title: Pineapple lady
coins.desc:
This woman is standing next to the giant Shine Gate north of the central dock area and she asks for pineapples.

Her basket is high off the ground so you'll need to throw (jump + B) the fruits in. Finding the best place to throw from takes a bit of trial and error but isn't as hard as it seems.

Alternatively, you can bounce on her head three times and if you land on the edge of the basket, you can then simply drop the fruit in. Can be repeated for a 1-up.

coins.title: Durian lady
coins.desc:
There are a few ways to get the durians to the basket but this seems to be the simplest.
Get a durian from under the awning near the boathouse. You can also get durians from the fruit market but it's farther away.

Gently kick it north along the boardwalk, then when you get close to the end aim toward the tree in the distance.

If you run at the durian and press the B button just before you get to it, you will give it a mighty kick that will send it far into the distance.

Then hover over and see where it landed (hopefully it didn't bounce into the water, if it did, just keep trying).
From there, kick the durian through the archway and then go left to the little hill.

coins.title: Shine gate M
coins.desc:
Locate the large crate in front of the Shine Gate (on the right side).

Ground-pound this crate to smash it and reveal a graffiti "M", then spray the wall clean for the coin to pop out.

coins.title: Rooftop M
coins.desc:
Locate the large crate on the rooftop over the inlet between the central dock and the ocean.

Ground-pound this crate to smash it and reveal a graffiti "M", then spray the wall clean for the coin to pop out.

coins.title: Tower M
coins.desc:
Go to the tower in the northwest corner of the plaza, near the red cannon that fires you over to Pinna Park.

Look on the north side about half way up to find a graffiti "M", then clean it off for the coin to appear.

coins.title: Paired crosses (A)
coins.desc:
Locate a graffiti cross on the east side of the base of the Pianta statue (right of the Bianco Hills entrance). Locate a corresponding cross one the west side of the southwest tower (the one with the radio dish).

Wash one cross off to make a blue coin appear at the other cross, then quickly get to the other cross to collect the coin before it disappears.


The slip-slide move is very useful here for covering the distance in time, or wait until you get the turbo nozzle and use it.

coins.title: Paired crosses (B)
coins.desc:
Locate a graffiti cross on the east side of the base of the Pianta statue (the one with the radio dish). Locate a corresponding cross one the west side of the southwest tower (right of the Bianco Hills entrance).

Wash one cross off to make a blue coin appear at the other cross, then quickly get to the other cross to collect the coin before it disappears.


The slip-slide move is very useful here for covering the distance in time, or wait until you get the turbo nozzle and use it.

coins.title: Flaming Pianta
coins.desc:
This might sound like the name of a refreshing cocktail, but after you open Gelato beach there actually is a Pianta fellow running around wearing a backpack that's on fire!

He normally is found on the beach near the lighthouse but may also appear next to the central dock.

You need to chase him around with FLUDD going to put out the fire, then talk to him to be rewarded with a blue coin. After collecting the coin, the same Pianta can be seen wandering around with his backpack full of red mushrooms.

coins.title: Blue parrots (A)
coins.desc: Spray the parrot on the roof of the building to the left of the shine gate. Wait for the parrot to fly near and squirt it in mid-air. A few good hits should turn it into a blue coin.

coins.title: Blue parrots (B)
coins.desc: Spray the parrot on the roof of the building north of the Pianta statue. Wait for the parrot to fly near and squirt it in mid-air. A few good hits should turn it into a blue coin.

coins.title: North Tunnel
coins.desc: There is a coin in the north end of a tunnel under the shine gate. (See video)

coins.title: Center Tunnel
coins.desc: There is a coin in a tunnel under the dock by the shine gate. (See video)

coins.title: West Tunnel
coins.desc: There is a coin in a underground passage that leads to the island with the coconut lady. (See video)

coins.title: Northeast tower window
coins.desc:
Go to the rooftops in the northeast section of the plaza, between the shine gate and the lighthouse. Look on the north side to find some orange goop covering a window. Get Yoshi and spray the goop with fruit juice and it melts away.

You can now hop into the window and collect the coin there. When you re-enter the plaza the goop will be restored even though there is no coin behind it.

coins.title: Northwest tower window
coins.desc:
Go to the rooftops in the northwest section of the plaza, near the red cannon, and look on the east side of the tower to find some orange goop covering a window near the top.

Get Yoshi and spray the goop with fruit juice so it melts away. Yoshi's fruit juice range is pretty good so you can to this from the next building over.

Abandon Yoshi and climb the small ledge circling the tower. The sidestep move may come in handy here.

Collect the coin when you reach the window.

coins.title: Stone pillars in the sea
coins.desc:
Locate the pillars a little out to sea from the lighthouse. One of the further-out pillars has a double door in the bottom of it, which hides a blue coin.

Equip the Turbo Nozzle and smash through the double doors to get the coin.

coins.title: Waiting room ice
coins.desc:
Collect 10 gold coins in the plaza and talk to the Pianta by the boat at the southwest dock. Pay the fare to be taken back to the airport.

You should see a turbo crate near the landing, so grab it and equip the turbo nozzle. Smash through the double doors of the building at the end of the landing to gain entrance to the airport waiting room.

On the right find a block of ice. Switch to the squirt nozzle and spray the ice until it melts away leaving a blue coin.

Notes:
 - You can only get this coin after you have entered Corona Mountain at least once (whether you defeat Bowser or exit the stage).
- Even though this is in the airport, it shows up in coin count for the plaza.

coins.title: Under the falls
coins.desc:
Look underwater to the left of where the water fall lands. Follow the trail of gold coins to find a blue coin at the end. There is a bubba swimming around down here who should be avoided.

You may want to avoid collecting all the gold coins on the swim down as you may need them for air on the swim back up.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: On the water (A)
coins.desc:
Two coins float just above the water. This one is to the left as you start.

Both coins are much easier to get once the water has been cleaned up starting episode 5, until then use the boat to reach them.
In episode 1 the boat is right next to the first coin instead of at the boathouse where it normally is.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: On the water (B)
coins.desc:
Two coins float just above the water. For this one, go to the left end of the cliff where it bows out in a semicircle. Then go straight out to sea from there to see the coin.

Both coins are much easier to get once the water has been cleaned up starting episode 5, until then use the boat to reach them.
In episode 1 the boat is right next to the first coin instead of at the boathouse where it normally is.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Upper right cubbyhole
coins.desc:
Go up the right cliff face and when you reach the second to last ledge, the one where the second pulley drops you off, check on the right for some narrow ledges sticking out of the cliff face.

Hover to the first one, then hover to the one on its right, where there may be a springboard. Use the springboard to get the ledge above, the do a series of back-flip and hover combinations to reach a ledge with a rocket nozzle crate. Back-flip and hover to the cubbyhole above to find a coin.

In episodes 5 and 7 the springboard is missing but it's still possible, though more difficult, to reach the ledges above it. Instead of stopping at the next to last ledge on the route to the top of the waterfall, go up another ledge, then do a triple jump right and hover.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Upper right coin stack
coins.desc:
From the ledge with the upper right cubbyhole coin, get the rocket nozzle and launch to collect gold coins and a blue coin at the top. You may have to hop just before the rocket goes off to get the extra few feet of altitude needed.

Visible in all episodes except 3, but not reachable in episode 5, 7 or 8 because the rocket nozzle isn't there.

coins.title: Under the diving board
coins.desc:
Locate the diving board shaped ledge next to the top of the water fall.

Go right and drop down to a ledge with a puddle of water, hop left from there and hover to a hole under the diving board, then collect the coin there.

In episode 6 there is a turbo nozzle crate here as well, but in other episodes there is a block of ice with a 1-up inside.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Hidden wall kicks
coins.desc:
From the hole under the diving board, drop and hover to another hole directly below. There is a vertical passage hidden behind a wall above this, though there are some windows to mark its position.

Do a series of wall jumps to get to the top and collect the coin that's visible through the windows.

See the coin "Lower pulley crevice" for an alternate and perhaps easier route.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Upper center cubbyhole
coins.desc:
Get to the top of the purple shell tower. This is easiest to do in episode 6 since there are wires you can use to get from tower to tower.

When you get to the shell entrance do a back-flip to the top. In earlier episodes you can use the rocket to this spot. From the shell, look straight toward the cliff face and notice a cubbyhole.

Rocket or hover toward it to either land inside or grab the ledge, then pick up the coin. For an alternative strategy, see the "Tricky ruins cubbyhole" coin.

Available all episodes except 3.

coins.title: Eely's domain columns (A)
coins.desc:
There are four blue coins in Eely-mouth's domain. When you enter the area, swim toward the outer walls and check the tops of the columns.

It's much easier to do this in episode 8 because the columns have gold coins as well and you can refresh your air. Also the gold coins surrounding the blue coins make it easier to spot the location from a distance.

In episode 8 there are two additional columns with gold coins only, so keep looking until you've found all six coin columns. Some of the coin columns go almost up to the ceiling so don't let yourself sink far when you're searching.

Available episodes 4 and 8 only.

coins.title: Eely's domain columns (B)
coins.desc:

Available episodes 4 and 8 only.
